1.text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.

2.text: Keep my commandments, and live; and my teaching, as the apple of thine eye.

3.text: Bind them upon thy fingers, write them upon the tablet of thy heart.

4.text: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister, and call intelligence [thy] kinswoman:

5.text: that they may keep thee from the strange woman, from the stranger who flattereth with her words.

6.text: For at the window of my house, I looked forth through my lattice,

7.text: and I beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the sons, a young man void of understanding,

8.text: passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,

9.text: in the twilight, in the evening of the day, in the blackness of night and the darkness.

10.text: And behold, there met him a woman in the attire of a harlot, and subtle of heart.

11.text: She is clamorous and unmanageable; her feet abide not in her house:

12.text: now without, now in the broadways,â€”and she lieth in wait at every corner.

13.text: And she caught him and kissed him, and with an impudent face said unto him,

14.text: I have peace-offerings with me; this day have I paid my vows:

15.text: therefore came I forth to meet thee, to seek earnestly thy face, and I have found thee.

16.text: I have decked my bed with tapestry coverlets of variegated linen from Egypt;

17.text: I have perfumed my couch with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.text: Come, let us revel in love until the morning, let us delight ourselves with loves.

19.text: For the husband is not at home, he is gone a long journey;

20.text: he hath taken the money-bag with him, he will come home on the day of the full moon.

21.text: With her much enticement she beguiled him; with the smoothness of her lips she constrained him.

22.text: He went after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, and as stocks [serve] for the correction of the fool;

23.text: till an arrow strike through his liver: as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for its life.

24.text: And now, ye sons, hearken unto me, and attend to the words of my mouth.

25.text: Let not thy heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths:

26.text: for she hath cast down many wounded, and all slain by her were strong.

27.text: Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the chambers of death.
